tit.j: 手塚 良仙（良庵）（てづか りょうせん（りょうあん）、文政9年（1826年） - 明治10年（1877年）10月10日）は、幕末、明治の医師、蘭学者。
tit.e: Ryosen TEZUKA (also known as Ryoan TEZUKA, 1826-October 10, 1877) was a doctor and Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) from the end of Edo period to Meiji period.
tit.cmt: 「医師。蘭学者。」→「医師、蘭学者」一文に変更しました。
tit.e: Ryosen TEZUKA (also known as Ryoan TEZUKA: 1826-October 10, 1877) was a doctor and Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) who lived from the end of Edo period to Meiji period.
tit.cmt: 表現を少し変えました。
tit.e: Ryosen TEZUKA (also known as Ryoan TEZUKA: 1826-October 10, 1877) was a doctor and Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) who lived from the end of Edo period to Meiji period.

sen.e: His birth name was Kokyo (Ryosen was a hereditary name of his family).
His birth name was Kokyo (Ryosen was a hereditary name of his family).
sen.cmt: ()の説明は原文には無いのですが、あったほうがわかりやすいように思います。
sen.e: His birth name was Kokyo.
sen.cmt: (Ryosen was a hereditary name of his family)は原文にないので削除しました。

sen.j: 息子は司法官の手塚太郎。
sen.e: His son, Taro TEZUKA, served as a judicial officer.
His son, Taro TEZUKA, served as a judicial officer.
His son, Taro TEZUKA, served as a judicial officer.

sen.j: 大槻俊斎は義兄にあたる。
sen.e: Shunsai OTSUKI is referred to his brother-in-law.
Shunsai OTSUKI is his brother-in-law.
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: Shunsai OTSUKI is his brother-in-law.

sen.j: 漫画家の手塚治虫の曾祖父である。
sen.e: Ryosen TEZUKA is known as great-grandfather of Osamu TEZUKA.
Ryosen TEZUKA is known as the great-grandfather of Osamu TEZUKA.
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: Ryosen TEZUKA is known as the great-grandfather of Osamu TEZUKA.

sen.j: 江戸の蘭方医、常陸国常陸府中藩藩医手塚良仙 (父)を父に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born to his father, Ryosen TEZUKA (his father), who was Ranpoi (a person who studied Western medicine by means of the Dutch language) in Edo and a Edo-period doctor working at a public clinic of Hitachifuchu Domain in Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was born to Ryosen TEZUKA (his father), who worked as a Ranpoi (a person who studied Western medicine by means of the Dutch language) in Edo (current Tokyo) and as a doctor at a public clinic of Hitachifuchu Domain in Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: He was born to Ryosen TEZUKA (his father), who worked as a Ranpoi (a person who studied Western medicine by means of the Dutch language) in Edo (current Tokyo) and as a doctor at a public clinic of Hitachifuchu Domain in Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 緒方洪庵の適塾に入門。
sen.e: He became a disciple of Koan OGATA's Tekijuku (a school for Dutch studies in Osaka).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 適塾の説明Tekijuku (a school for Dutch studies in Osaka)を加えました。
sen.e: He became a disciple of Koan OGATA and studied at Tekijuku (a school for Dutch studies in Osaka) lead by Ogata..
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: He became a disciple of Koan OGATA and studied at Tekijuku (a school for Dutch studies in Osaka) lead by Ogata..
He got close to Yukichi FUKUZAWA.
He made friends with Yukichi FUKUZAWA and others.
He made friends with Yukichi FUKUZAWA and others.

sen.j: 江戸に帰って、大槻俊斎・伊東玄朴らと図り、お玉が池種痘所設立。
sen.e: He cooperated with Shunsai OTSUKI and Genboku ITO to establish the Shutosho (a vaccination institute) at Otamagaike after he returned to Edo.
He returned to Edo and founded Shutosho (a vaccination institute) at Otamagaike in cooperation with Shunsai OTSUKI and Genboku ITO.
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: He returned to Edo and founded Shutosho (a vaccination institute) at Otamagaike in cooperation with Shunsai OTSUKI and Genboku ITO.

sen.j: 父を継ぎ良仙と改名し、幕府歩兵屯所付医師となり、維新後大日本帝国陸軍軍医となる。
sen.e: After his succession to his father's name of Ryosen, he became an exclusive doctor of foot soldiers' quarters of Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and then a medical officer of the Imperial Japanese Army after Meiji Restoration.

Having succeeded to his father's name Ryosen, he became an exclusive doctor to the quarters of foot soldiers in the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and after the Meiji Restoration, he served as a medical officer in the Imperial Japanese Army.
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: Having succeeded to his father's name Ryosen, he became an exclusive doctor to the quarters of foot soldiers in the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and after the Meiji Restoration, he served as a medical officer in the Imperial Japanese Army.
(Equivalent grade with captains)
(Officer with a grade equivalent to the captain)
(Officers of the rank of captain)

sen.j: 西南戦争に従軍、九州で赤痢に罹り、長崎陸軍病院にて没。
sen.e: While he served in the Satsuma Rebellion, he was stricken with diarrhea in Kyushu region, and died in an army hospital in Nagasaki.
While he served in the Satsuma Rebellion, he was stricken with diarrhea in the Kyushu region, and died in the army hospital in Nagasaki.
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: While he served in the Satsuma Rebellion, he was stricken with diarrhea in the Kyushu region, and died in the army hospital in Nagasaki.
Ninpu Sessei Ryakuko (A Regimen of Pregnant Women)
"Ninpu Sessei Ryakko" (A brief regimen for pregnant women)
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: "Ninpu Sessei Ryakko" (A brief regimen for pregnant women)

sen.j: 曾孫である手塚治虫は、後に手塚良仙を主人公の1人とした伝記漫画「陽だまりの樹」を執筆している。
sen.e: Osamu TEZUKA, his great-grandchild, wrote a biography manga (cartoon) later, 'Hidamari no ki' (Trees in the sun) featuring Ryosen TEZUKA as one of the main characters.
In later years, Osamu TEZUKA, his great-grandchild, wrote a biographical manga (cartoon) titled, 'Hidamari no ki' (Trees in the sun) featuring Ryosen TEZUKA as one of the main characters.
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: In later years, Osamu TEZUKA, his great-grandchild, wrote a biographical manga (cartoon) titled, 'Hidamari no ki' (Trees in the sun) featuring Ryosen TEZUKA as one of the main characters.

sen.j: ストーリーは史実を下地にフィクションを加えた内容になっている。
sen.e: The story includes a fiction based on a historical fact.
The story is written based on a historical fact embroidered with factious stories.
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: The story is written based on a historical fact embroidered with factious stories.

sen.j: みなもと太郎の「風雲児たち幕末篇」にも手塚良仙は登場する。
sen.e: Ryosen TEZUKA appears in 'Fuunjitachi Bakumatsuhen' (The Lucky Adventurers at The End of Edo Period) written by Taro MINAMOTO.
Ryosen TEZUKA also appears as one of the characters in "Fuunjitachi Bakumatsu-hen" (The Lucky Adventurers at The End of Edo Period) written by a Japanese manga artist Taro MINAMOTO,
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: Ryosen TEZUKA also appears as one of the characters in "Fuunjitachi Bakumatsu-hen" (The Lucky Adventurers at The End of Edo Period) written by a Japanese manga artist Taro MINAMOTO,

sen.j: 作風が「歴史大河ギャグ」だけあって手塚治虫風の顔に描かれている。
sen.e: The rendering of his face looks like Osamu TEZUKA just as expected of the style, 'the rekishi taiga gag' (the historical period manga full of gags).

As it is a long-scale serial gag strip based on the history, the personality of Ryosen TEZUKA has a face rendering a certain looks of Osamu TEZUKA, Ryosen's great-grandchild as well as a famous manga artist.
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: It was a long-running, historically themed serial gag strip, in which the artist rendered faces in a manner rather similar to that of Osamu TEZUKA (Ryosen's great-grandchild and a famous manga artist).
